Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
hi - yes it is probably a long wait.  in march/april - we were still testing a lot of the tech, so understanding what was going to be gold and what was going to be brown sheets was very important.
docs, dex app, multi-coin wallet, chain generator, application logic on chain, anti fud, dpow, mm2 = rebrand
all the work has to align so it's an appealing project to adopt.
some of the code is still being tested, so knowing what is marketable & usable is a 2-way street.
there's a lot of tech, and the rebrand is part of the new standard in blockchain tech.
james made some incredible stuff happen over the last 3 years that built on the previous 3 years.
komodo has one last hard fork to come and new notaries before it's never looking back.   imo anyway.
a) don't want brown sheets
b) don't want vapourware
c) want to manage people's expectations that use the tech
if you are not using the tech, ask questions how to use it.  spin up your own blockchains, make a tokendex, lock up some of your custom coins for rewards like a masternode network.
there is a crypto price competition to do with the prices of forex, stocks and other cryptos that some of the techs are working on as well.   prices of stocks & forex in crypto, all blockchain enforced.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Except that the entire delay hold back everything else,  because imagery all changes,  terminology is all changing ( why, who knows ),   So every other aspect of marketing gets held back,  no marketing materials,  no consistent messaging ,  no acquiring personnel to get the word out.

Author: joe2x4#5987
Content: As craptacular as Bitcointalk is, in the beginning it provided a wealth of information and support for btc. Who set that up, Satoshi? Once altcoins came about, BTT went steadiy downhill but was still the defacto place to get crypto info. I believe we are well beyond the chat forum, and kmd ecosystem is it's own beast and needs a way to display its ecosystem to the world. Heck, there are people on discord that have never even heard of chips

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
also things like partner networks are being revised, what is a training partner, what is an integration partner, a reseller, a tech partner and a cloud partner.   these things don't exist in current komodo nor many other projects.  understanding how to put brilliant tech together into a form that pros can use.   we have one-shot at a rebrand.   one-shot to wow a lot of eyeballs at once.

yeah forums are good, one of my tasks is how to integrate it more effectively.   initially i had created a demo community site with single sign on with the forum - this was not originally unleashed because of the above - aligning everything so it all is a cohesive message.

the earliest versions of a cohesive message were mid 2018, komodo lowers the barriers to blockchain adoption, you spin up your chain, you get your coins into a wallet, you get listed on a dex.   the message now is you get security, scalability and a bunch of new stuff out of the box.

Author: grumpygoron#4320
Content: How‚Äôs progress going on the website updates / rebrand?  Anything able to be reviewed by the public soon?

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
internal deadline for technical documentation is looming bu tthis does not mean the rebrand, tech docs is part of rebrand.
there is a campaign due to start soon.
14 hours ago internal team got the final beta to test before public beta - that will probably take the weekend and a day or two to thoroughly make acceptible for release.
the marketing messaging has been "nearly final" for most lines of business/products/software for a couple of weeks.
that polish going from nearly-final to final is a fine line when it cuts across many parts of the project, not just the "coin" and when we are doing a rebrand, the message is not just some upgrade to tech, it's a leading role in crypto adoption (in my humble opinion)

Yeah just a couple quick updates

Author: designer#4893
Content:
sea is a source of international order. without the concept of sea lanes, not only can the spirit of the West be incomprehensible, but the source of modern international relations be incomprehensible.

money that pirates demand for ransom is called "real money," and the money that pirates recognize is a source of imagination: Trustless Trust. 

argument that bitcoin should be eliminated because criminals use bitcoin is logically not far from the idea that Venice's money should be removed because pirates have acknowledged it.

"bitcoin phenomenon," a strange phenomenon faced by mankind today, is different from the new industrial technology commonly referred to as blockchain. this phenomenon is clear and humanistic intellectuals who have missed bitcoin must admit that they have a narrow understanding of the source of the currency.

today, the complex international relations we face also have to do with changes in the marine order. bitcoin also exists as a result of the old order, although it may be the cause of the new international order.

It was the conclusion reached in 2014 that bitcoin was not a "happening" and its roots were unexpectedly very deep and sound.

now is the time for the humanities and knowledge communities to deal with the formidable phenomenon of bitcoin.

Author: designer#4893
Content: I think we shouldn't rush to an economist to understand the bitcoin phenomenon. Rather, I am sure that very humane books such as Nanami Shiono's Eastern Mediterranean Trilogy after Rome, Sapiens of Yuval Noah Harari, and The Rise of Christianity of Rodney Stark provide clues to the insight.

Author: designer#4893
Content:
"That's enough" and "Our competitors are like us," maybe I can fool myself, but I can't fool the market. You have to make the perfect product. If you're going to make a clumsy product, go home and sleep.
Germany cares about the 0.1 mm difference, Japan is talking about 0.3 mm and the United States is talking about 0.5 mm, but China cares about 1 mm. That's why the word German engineering is still meaningful on the hardware side, and China has to make more efforts for this reason." That's how much Germany and Japan put great effort and effort into pursuing perfection, and the market seems to be well aware of these subtle differences, although they are all the same on the surface.
Bitcoin founder Satoshi Nakamoto applied the principles of microeconomics to the existing cryptographic technology and included people to form the most robust system created by mankind.

Author: JAG#5172
Content:
Greetings,

I wanted to shoot out a message to members of the Komodo team and community to see if you would be interested in recording a podcast for my week long podcast series of the Komodo Project. 

I recorded a podcast with two Komodo team members several weeks ago and it was a big success. Many people contacted me asking to create more episodes and I would love to bring on anyone who is interested. Here is a list of topics I would like to create a podcast over, each topic would be its own podcast:

-Why Komodo is a better blockchain solution
   --Blockchain difficulties, scaling issues, problems Komodo solves, etc

-Antara
  --What Antara is, it's frame work, smart-chains, why its a superior solution, etc.

-Komodo economics
  --Token supply, POS, staking, price outlook, scarcity, etc.

- How to customize your blockchain
   --How its done, why its important, how business can adopt this solution, etc

-Blockchain Web app on AWS
   --How to use it, how business can adopt it, etc

PM me if interested or shoot me an email at drew@crusayder.com

Author: Steve Lee#1967
Content: Hi @JAG yes we'd be interested. Please DM me to discuss.
